divs: sighting detailsi reported this incident to your network two years ago. that is when i first noticed this object. though the light did disappear for a few months last year, it has returned. everynight it appears around dusk in the north western sky of cincinnati, oh. it is always the brightest light in the sky. it first appears high in the sky and slowly descends behind the horizon. it takes about 2 1\2 hours to make this journey. it's the same thing everynight for the last two years, besides those few months when it was not there. one time, however, i did see it do something differnet from it's normal course. a few weeks after first spotting the bright light, i walked outside as usual to watch "my light" as i have come to call it. it was around 20 minutes from dipping behind the horizon. not even a minute after sitting down and gazing at "my light", it increased it's brightness for a second or two, then returned to it's normal brightness. it then proceeded to move off to the east, taking it's time. after about 20 seconds it disappeared from my field of view. this proved to me, "my light" is not a planet or star. i admit, it could be a sattelite, but i don't think so. i have showed the light to numerous people, and no one has any explanation as to what the hell this thing could be. i showed it to a buddy of mine, who used to work at our local airport, and he shrugged it off as a plane coming in for landing. he's not into paranormal stuff, so he refused to watch the light with me as it slowly descended. he had more important stuff to do. i'll admit 'my light" does resemble a huge airplane light, but that it is not. all i want to know is what this thing is and i figure your network would be the best place to get my question answered. thank you for your time. p.s. about a year and a half ago, i was in north carolina, and there was "my light" visible in the night sky.
Summary: I first noticed this object on a walk and was instantly curious on what it was.
